title: 5th Nov 2024 : Firefox Update = lost Paswords, Bookmarks & History
content:
5th Nov 2024 Hi, Firfox has just (few hours ago) updated.. It has 'lost' ALL of my (several years of) PASSWORDS, BOOKMARKS and HISTORY I have tried the fixes given on the forum,. but there doesn't seem to be anything there to recover. And frankly the whole 'other profile' thing confused me.

Can anybody help please.. ?

Thank you Phil
creator: mrphils

title: Logitech camera is not recognized
content: My Logitech 1080 camera is working and recognized on Chrome and Edge. It is not recognized on Firefox, even though I have the settings allowing the camera on a list of sites, and have restarted it several times.. I can't find it on the connected devices list, etc. I HATE having to open Edge for every vidcon call!
creator: johnwoji

title: Recovering Account - See Details
content:
I thought I just needed to sync my account ( three bars > user name > sync now) and sign out before resetting my computer. After doing so I thought by signing in it would recover my bookmarks and passwords, etc. I did NOT do the proper way: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/switching-devices which I realized after performing the reset.

Am I completely SOL? Or is there a way to recover these - I really hope there is I had a lot of bookmarks.

Thank you for your time and support!
creator: account58

title: prime videos will not play, update but still get update FF notice
content:
I have a MacMini M2 with the current Sonoma os. Firefox has been updated. Frustrating. Yet prime videos won't play and get this notice:

"Mozilla Firefox update required A later version of Mozilla Firefox is required for Prime Video. To update, click the menu button (three horizontal stripes) on the web browser toolbar, click Help, About Firefox, and then click Restart to update Firefox."

Please help me make Firefox translate to English 100% of the time or at least as close as possible to 100%.

title: Video players don't work
content:
So I can open up Youtube no problem, scroll around and even hover over a video for the preview. However the moment I click on a video the tab will crash. I check if this was the case for other video streaming sites. HBO Max has the same issue while Amazon prime doesn't crash however has a message saying there is a problem with the video player. Now I checked if videos can work on another browser (Microsoft Edge), and there are no issues. I have cleared the cache, disabled extensions, checked for updates [update to date: 132.0.1 (64-bit)], restarted Firefox from troubleshooting mode, enabled autoplay, checked if videos work in private mode, updated my graphics card driver, and even checked if Firefox's volume is muted (its not).


Crash ID: 145d84d4-c11c-41a8-9534-e00ff0241105 Signature: [@ std::basic_string<T>::_Construct ]

https://crash-stats.mozilla.org/report/index/145d84d4-c11c-41a8-9534-e00ff0241105#tab-debug
creator: thekim0517

title: 2 versions of FireFox?
content: I've been using Firefox for years with no problems. Today I opened it and it wanted me to make it my default browser, which it already was, but I did it anyway. Now when I click a link in an email in Thunderbird, Firefox loads but all my passwords and user names are gone. If I close and reload Firefox and cut and paste the link, I have my passwords and user names back and everything is normal. Windows 10 shows only one version of Firefox installed, but for awhile settings/default apps listed 2 versions (now it only shows one). How do I change this?
creator: dstauffer2

content: getting an error code saying "Error, platform version 132.0.1 is not compatible with.... Maybe try to reinstall Firefox?

title: how to stop firefox from "shuffling" between 2 open windows
content: hi. i have (too) many windows and tabs open - and whenever i click the firefox icon in my dock, it doesn't go to the window i was just in - instead it chooses a different window and i get back to the original window by clicking the dock icon again - how do i make this stop?
creator: jackie.sussman

title: (RESOLVED) Twitch streams suddenly stopped working.
content:
I have no idea why, but all of a sudden Twitch streams won't work on Firefox. It's only affecting Twitch because I can load YouTube and other streaming sites fine, and it's only on Firefox because it works fine on Chrome. I tried clearing my cache and cookies, disabling all add-ons and extensions, and restarting my device. Nothing works. The only indication that I have of what the issue might be is a message in the browser console that says this:

NetworkError: A network error occurred. addcf53b-cec4-4980-829e-de0aca27def2:1 

   <anonymous> blob:https://www.twitch.tv/addcf53b-cec4-4980-829e-de0aca27def2:1

From what I can tell, the blob is where the browser loads the stream itself. Every stream I've tried to load gives me this error.

UPDATE: I was able to fix it by clearing the cache.
creator: appledoze
